sentences:
Bicycle Thieves (; sometimes known in the United States as The Bicycle Thief ) is a 1948 Italian drama film directed by Vittorio De Sica .
The film follows the story of a poor father searching post - World War II Rome for his stolen bicycle , without which he will lose the job which was to be the salvation of his young family .
Adapted for the screen by Cesare Zavattini from a novel by Luigi Bartolini , and starring Lamberto Maggiorani as the desperate father and Enzo Staiola as his plucky young son , Bicycle Thieves is widely regarded as a masterpiece of Italian neorealism .
It received an Academy Honorary Award in 1950 and , just four years after its release , was deemed the greatest film of all time by Sight & Sound magazine 's poll of filmmakers and critics ; fifty years later the same poll ranked it sixth among the greatest - ever films .
It is also one of the top ten among the British Film Institute 's list of films you should see by the age of 14 .
